description: Hip Hop Feminism combines Womanist Thought with Hip Hop. Hip Hop Feminism engages with the contradictions of identifying as feminist while still enjoying misogynistic aspects of Hip Hop. This course discusses aspects of Hip Hop culture that relate to Black womanhood and girlhood, such as double-dutch, hair braiding, twerking, and playground games Students engage with core Hip Hop Feminism concepts such as "the personal is political," respectability politics, intersectionality, Black Girl Magic, and radical self-love. Offered periodically.
name: Hip Hop Feminism
notes: This course is open to a limited-number of rising sophomores and incoming
